notes: Phase 2 opponent identity tags for Architect/Dynasty AI. Used to shape matchup gameplans, slider tendencies, and live coaching rules. Teams: PIT, BOS, NYI, NJD.

identity.summary: Veteran core that wants to create offense through east–west puck movement and high-skill plays in the offensive zone.

offense_profile.entry_style: Controlled entries with delayed cuts and drop passes.
offense_profile.cycle_style: Short, quick-touch cycle to pull coverage off structure.

weaknesses: Defending net-front chaos and second chances

goalie_profile.rebound_tendency: Medium-high on low shots through traffic

systems.forecheck: 2-3 to start; shift to 1-2-2 Aggressive only if down in 3rd
systems.defensive_strategy: Staggered with curl-shooter watch on circles
systems.defensive_pressure: Contain Puck baseline; temporary High Pressure vs repeated curl-and-shoot
systems.trap_slider_rule: Start at 3; drop to 2 when protecting a lead, go to 4 only if chasing in 3rd.

slider_emphasis.carry_dump: Favour Carry with L1/L2 to exploit slower D gaps.
slider_emphasis.cycle_shoot: Cycle 5–6 on top lines; generate lateral seams not pure bombs.
slider_emphasis.net_front: Crash harder with L3 to punish rebounds and depth D.

matchup_notes.target_pairs: Attack PIT Pair 2/3 off the rush; wide entries into slower side.
matchup_notes.danger_lines: Respect veteran scoring line; priority on tying up sticks in slot.
matchup_notes.pk_template: Treat PIT as 'Shooting PP' – tighter box, shot blocking priority.

identity.summary: Elite structure, strong goaltending, and heavy play along the boards. They win through discipline, details, and low-event hockey.

systems.defensive_pressure: Contain Puck baseline with bursts of High Pressure

primary_threats: Point shots with heavy net-front screens
offense_profile.cycle_style: Heavy cycle, protect-puck along boards, feed points.

weaknesses: Can be stretched by fast east–west passes after extended zone time
Occasional issues with speed off set plays vs third pair
If hemmed, may ice the puck more often

systems.forecheck: 1-2-2 Passive or 2-3; avoid reckless aggression early.
systems.neutral_zone: 1-3-1 when protecting a lead; 1-2-2 Red baseline.
systems.defensive_pressure: Contain Puck; only go High Pressure after clean possession.
systems.trap_slider_rule: Start at 3; if they are clogging NZ hard, bump to 4 mid-game to push pace; drop to 2 late when defending lead.

slider_emphasis.cycle_shoot: Higher Cycle for L1/L2 (5–7) to pull structure apart before shots.
slider_emphasis.screening: Commit to net-front presence vs elite goaltending; L3 crash bias higher.
slider_emphasis.pinch_rules: D Pair 3 pinch slider lower (3–4) to avoid odd-man rush vs structured team.

matchup_notes.target_pairs: Work against BOS third pair with speed and width.
matchup_notes.danger_lines: Top line and PP bumper are high priority; sticks in lane over hits.
matchup_notes.pk_template: Treat BOS as hybrid 'Shooting + bumper PP' – mix of lane blocks and inner-slot denial.

identity.summary: Classic trap-and-grind team with elite goaltending and strong defensive structure. They want 2–1 games, not track meets.

systems.powerplay: Net-front screen with point shooting (1-3-1 variant)
systems.pp_carry_dump: Dump-and-retrieve or controlled, depending on line

primary_threats: Greasy goals after long cycle shifts

strengths: Clearing rebounds from front of net
weaknesses: Limited high-end playmaking beyond top line
Struggles if forced to trade chances up-tempo
Third pair D can be beaten wide by speed

goalie_profile.rebound_tendency: Low; most shots swallowed or steered safely

systems.neutral_zone: 1-2-2 Red; avoid skating into their trap lanes blind.
systems.defensive_strategy: Staggered; protect middle, force outside shots.
systems.defensive_pressure: Normal/Contain; do not chase them below goal line unnecessarily.
systems.trap_slider_rule: Start at 3; if the game is getting too dead, bump to 4 mid-game to open it up. When leading, happily sit at 2 and let them chase.

slider_emphasis.cycle_shoot: Higher Cycle early (5–6) to stretch their shell, then shoot through traffic.
slider_emphasis.net-front: Mandatory screeners vs Sorokin-type; raise crash bias especially with L3/L4.
slider_emphasis.pinch_rules: P1/P2 normal; keep P3 pinch conservative (3) to avoid getting burned by rare counterattacks.

matchup_notes.target_pairs: Exploit Islanders’ 3rd pair with speed, cross-ice plays after controlled entries.
matchup_notes.danger_lines: Top line and any page built around Barzal-type speed; otherwise, respect volume, not flash.
matchup_notes.pk_template: Treat NYI PP as 'net-front shooting PP' – focus on box tightness + net-front sticks.

identity.summary: Speed and skill engine. They want track meets, off-the-rush chances, and broken-play offense off turnovers.

systems.pp_carry_dump: Carry entries with speed almost always

primary_threats: Quick-strike PP with one-timers from the circles
offense_profile.entry_style: Fast, controlled, with mid-lane drive and wide support.
offense_profile.cycle_style: Short, sharp cycles leading to seam passes.

strengths: Jumping into rushes from the back end
weaknesses: Can get caught with forwards high in OZ
Defensive-zone coverage breaks down under extended cycle
Net-front protection not as heavy as BOS/NYI

goalie_profile.rebound_tendency: Medium-high, especially on low shots in traffic

systems.forecheck: 1-2-2 Passive or 2-3 to start; do NOT feed their transition early.
systems.neutral_zone: 1-3-1 ideal vs rush; 1-2-2 Red acceptable if you keep good gaps.
systems.defensive_pressure: Contain Puck baseline; only go High Pressure in OZ after they’re tired.
systems.trap_slider_rule: Start at 2 (trap leaning) to kill their rush game; raise to 3–4 only if you’re chasing.

slider_emphasis.carry_dump: More Dump with L3/L4 to keep puck deep and avoid long neutral-zone turnovers.
slider_emphasis.cycle_shoot: Cycle 5–6 to keep them in their zone; shoot low for rebounds vs average goalie.
slider_emphasis.efficiency_energy: Slightly higher Energy bias to survive high-tempo pace across 60 minutes.

matchup_notes.target_pairs: Hem NJD’s offensive D in their zone; long cycles tire them and reduce jump.
matchup_notes.danger_lines: Top skill lines must be kept out of track-meet situations; prefer controlled, slow games.
matchup_notes.pk_template: Treat Devils PP as 'rush + 1-3-1 skill PP' – respect seams, cut off royal road passes first.
